intro: Byrsonima verbascifolia subsp. villosa, commonly known as the woolly hibiscus, is a shrub native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family and is known for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed or open habitats. The subspecies villosa distinguishes itself through its dense pubescence, which gives it a woolly appearance.
